title: Federation between SMA OS type and UCMDB OsFamily
content:
When Native SACM is enabled, the OS type field in SMA is federated with the OsFamily attribute in UCMDB. There are five preset OS values in either system, which are mapped according to the following table.
 

SMA OS type UCMDB OsFamily
Windows windows
UNIX unix
Virtual address extension (VAX) vax
Mainframe mainframe
Bare metal hypervisor baremetal_hypervisor

Apart from these preset OS values, you can also have custom list values in both systems. If you have a custom OS type in SMA, you must manually create a corresponding OsFamily attribute in UCMDB. Make sure the suffix _c is not appended in UCMDB OsFamily value. In addition, these custom values are case-sensitive, we strongly recommend that you create precisely the same custom values in both systems. That is, to create a new OS type, make sure to use the same spelling and capitalization in both SMA and UCMDB. For example, you have a custom OS type value "Macintosh_c" in SMA, you must create an OsFamily value "Macintosh" in UCMDB.

For more information about how to create list values in UCMDB, see Create List and Enumeration definitions.

Note: If you fail to create precisely the same custom values in both SMA and UCMDB, the value may still be synchronized to SMA, however, some features may not function. For example, you have a custom OS type value "Macintosh_c" in SMA and have a custom OsFamily value "macintosh" in UCMDB. With Native SACM enabled, the value "macintosh" is synchronized to SMA, however, if you try to use a filter "OS type = Macintosh" to find the record, it won't work.
